instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3476 -  Turn on, But
threads.message:
I Get:
- Green Light
- Fan Spin
- Almost all the Rails

The PP3V3 is low, like 2v:
- PP3V3_SO - 2v
- PP3V3_S0_FET - 2V
                   R5360 - 2V
                   R5361 - 2V


The PPVCC_SO_CPU is low to:
0.53v

Do you guys have any idea what happen? My humble conclusion is a SMC, but i'm not sure.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3476 -  Turn on, But
threads.message: Water damage?? remove everything and try LB alone..... Measure PP3V3 and report value...

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3476 -  Turn on, But
threads.message: [USER="36"]aprendiz[/USER] No liquid damage and yes, i get the measurement just the board.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3476 -  Turn on, But
threads.message: Q7830, voltage on pin 4 and pin 1..

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3476 -  Turn on, But
threads.message: Are u sure about Q7830? I can't find, [USER="36"]aprendiz[/USER]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3476 -  Turn on, But
threads.message: sorry, U8030 voltage in VIN and VOUT

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3476 -  Turn on, But
threads.message:
VIN PP3V3_S5 - 3.3v
VOUT PP3v3_SO_FET = 2v

and

P3V3S0_EN - 3.3v

U8030 is bad?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3476 -  Turn on, But
threads.message: Not yet, measure resistance from VOUT to ground, also can apply voltage on VOUT and check if something getting hot.....

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3476 -  Turn on, But
threads.message: I just inject 1, 2 and 3v  and nothing gets warm

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3476 -  Turn on, But
threads.message:
Replaced and works!
I will test with ASD and ready to go!
Thank you [USER="36"]aprendiz[/USER] and [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER]
